meanings.definition: To last longer than something else.
meanings.sent1: The old tree is outlasting the new saplings in the forest.
meanings.sent2: The durable backpack is outlasting all the others on the market.
meanings.sent3: The marathon runner joked that he was outlasting the energizer bunny.
meanings.sent4: Her love for him was outlasting the changing seasons.
meanings.sent5: The ancient ruins stood outlasting the passing centuries.

meanings.definition: To continue to exist or be successful for a longer period of time than something else.
meanings.sent1: The small business is outlasting its competitors in the tough market.
meanings.sent2: The tradition of family dinners is outlasting the fast-food trend.
meanings.sent3: The little plant in the office was outlasting all expectations.
meanings.sent4: His determination was outlasting any doubts that came his way.
meanings.sent5: The friendship between them was outlasting any disagreements.
